linkedinTeaser:
Stanford researchers gave people the same wine. Told them one cost $45, the other $5.

Brain scans showed the "expensive" wine activated MORE pleasure centers.

Not just self-reported enjoyment. Actual neural activity.

The perception didn't influence the story. It changed the physical experience.

For anyone running a gym, retail store, or hospitality venue: you're in the business of constructed experiences whether you realize it or not.

New post on what neuroscience teaches us about pricing, cognitive load, and why every signal you send either builds or breaks the experience.
